main event: An unidentified luminous object was observed flying towards the ground at Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico, on 15 February 1950.
interesting points: The object appeared to be red and green in color, with a round shape and the apparent size of a normal marble.
It was observed by CPT Robert G. P. Enright from the 548th Military Police Company, who was engaged in activities such as golfing, horseback riding, shuffleboard, and swimming.
The observation lasted approximately 30 seconds, during which the object exhibited a speed similar to that of a shooting star and a faint trailing edge.
No sound or odor, and no specific maneuvers or projections were observed. The object eventually faded out and had no effect on the observer.
The conclusion of the investigation was that the observed object was evaluated as a meteor.
sighted object: luminous object with red and green color
location: Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico
witnesses: CPT Robert G. P. Enright and Cpl ROBERT C. J. BURHANS from the 548th Military Police Company
